meanings.definition: An infectious bacterial disease characterized by the growth of nodules (tubercles) in the tissues, especially in the lungs.
meanings.sent1: Tuberculosis can spread through the air when an infected person coughs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use chest X-rays to diagnose tuberculosis in patients.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria causing tuberculosis decided to have a party in the lungs.
meanings.sent4: Her love for adventure was like tuberculosis, slowly spreading through her veins.
meanings.sent5: The image of tiny nodules growing in the lungs haunted her dreams, a sign of tuberculosis.

meanings.sent1: Scientists are studying the tuberculosis bacterium to develop better treatments.
meanings.sent2: The tuberculosis bacterium can survive for a long time outside the body.
meanings.sent3: The tuberculosis bacterium threw a party in the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: The presence of the tuberculosis bacterium in the body was like a silent invader.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the tuberculosis bacterium looked like a tiny troublemaker.
